title: Hugo Lloris suffers gruesome elbow injury after howler against Brighton
text:
The French goalkeeper was left grimacing in pain after an awkward fall (Picture: Reuters)

Hugo Lloris was taken off on a stretcher in the early moments of Tottenham’s clash with Brighton after landing awkwardly on his left arm.

Spurs captain Lloris has been under pressure after a horrendous error against Southampton and then conceding seven goals to Bayern Munich in the Champions League.

The Frenchman was back in action just four days later at the Amex, but gave up his clean sheet when he was caught out by a goalbound Pascal Gross cross, dropping the ball for Neal Maupay to tap in.

Injury was then added to insult when Lloris threw his left hand behind him to catch his fall and trapped his arm under his body.

Lloris appeared to damage his elbow in the process of conceding the opening goal (Picture: BT Sport)

Lloris was left howling in pain by the injury (Picture: BT Sport)

Live footage appeared to show his left elbow bent at an unnatural angle and it was such a gruesome image that BT Sport chose not to show the slow-motion replays of the incident.

Lloris was quickly attended to by medics and given gas and air to deal with the obvious pain he was experiencing.

The goalkeeper was eventually taken off on a stretcher some six minutes after suffering the initial injury, replaced by Paulo Gazzaniga.

Lloris was taken straight to hospital but was screaming in pain on the way down the tunnel and required extra morphine to deal with the pain.

Lloris left on a stretcher and was taken straight to hospital (Picture: Getty)

Michael Owen suggested he had appeared to have suffered a dislocated elbow as messages of support flooded in on social media, included one from fellow goalkeeper David De Gea.

The Manchester United goalkeeper simply wrote the Spurs player’s name on Twitter, followed by the prayer emoji, echoing the thoughts of many in football.
